intro: Crucifera media, commonly known as the common cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. This annual herb typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with alternate, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or white, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in gardens, fields, and along waterways. It is known for its peppery flavor and has been used in various culinary and medicinal applications.
